meanings.definition: Obtain by devious or dishonest means.
meanings.sent1: He finagled his way into getting extra dessert.
meanings.sent2: She finagled a discount on the expensive watch.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox finagled the chickens out of their coop.
meanings.sent4: The con artist finagled his victims out of their life savings.
meanings.sent5: The sneaky raccoon finagled its way into the picnic basket.

meanings.definition: Achieve something by means of trickery or devious methods.
meanings.sent1: They finagled a free upgrade on their flight.
meanings.sent2: He finagled his way out of doing the chores.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat finagled its way into the closed room.
meanings.sent4: She finagled her rival out of the competition.
meanings.sent5: The cunning magician finagled the audience's applause.
